meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny! It's your boy back with another groovy review of Men of War II!

Now, I know what you're thinking - why should I care about a World War II RTS game? Well, let me tell you, this game is like a fine-tuned tank - it may not be the flashiest thing on the battlefield, but it packs a punch! And by "punch", I mean, it'll take up most of your weekend trying to master its complexities.

But don't just take my word for it - let's see what some of our fellow critics have to say. SpazioGames gave it a solid 77, saying that while it has some UI flaws and doesn't exactly hold your hand, the gameplay is "incredible deep". COGconnected also chimed in with a similar sentiment, praising its depth and complexity, but warning that casual players might feel overwhelmed.

Meanwhile, 3DJuegos just gave it a thumbs-up, calling it "a challenge" for RTS fans, and PC Gamer echoed that sentiment, saying it's "flawed but rewarding". Cubed3 was a bit more mixed, criticizing the clunky controls and complicated gameplay, but acknowledging its potential. And GameSpew? Well, they called it a "winner", even with some frustrations.

But what about IGN Italia, you ask? Ah, yes! They went all out, giving it an 80 and calling it an "astoundingly deep" real-time strategy game. Some might say that's a bit hyperbolic, but hey, I'm just happy they liked it!

So, what's the verdict? Well, if you're a fan of World War II or just looking for a good RTS game, Men of War II is definitely worth checking out. Just don't expect it to hold your hand - this game will keep you on your toes!
